alert.note: Alert for Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 8:17PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherry, northwestern Grant and southern Sheridan Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 715 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Ellsworth, or 22 miles east of Alliance, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Very heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ellsworth, Antioch, Watson Lake, Patterson Lake, Finnegan Lake, Kennedy Lake, Snow Lake, Bingham, Wickson Lake, Diamond Lake, Lakeside, Wolf Hill, Krause Lake and Argo Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 24. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 132. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
